result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Josephine R Alloway was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Josephine R Alloway was found guilty of Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IID on all vehicles titled in defendant's name for 3 years, commencing on upon issuance of a valid driver's license.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within first 6 months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 10 jobs per month, when children are in school, and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any business that sells alcohol except to pay for necessities (gas, groceries).
The defendant must attend at least one AA or similar meeting per week.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
Defendant is required to submit a DNA sample, if one has not been submitted, with no surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes:
Good time and huber allowed.

Community Service authorized under 973.3(3)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josephine R Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 59 days jail as  a condition of probation without huber

ADDRESS INFO for Josephine R Alloway
Current: P.O. Box 111, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2015)
Prior: 5361 Youngs Ln, 111, Crandon, WI 54520
of non-payment; application for commitment/license suspension

Called at 2:08 PM. Josephine Alloway appears in person and in custody with attorney Tim Drewa. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - submits exhibit #1 (certified driving record) - received after no objections - defendant would plead G to count #1 as alleged - acknowledge 3 priors OWI convictions, #2 - DRI, #3 - amend to county ordinance of bail jumping with a fine of $500 plus costs, #1 - joint recommendation of 3 years probation with conditions of: 1 year jail, $3697.00 fine, 3 year DL revocation, IID, AODA, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of community service. Drewa and Alloway agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2, amends count #3 to county ordinance violation of bail jumping, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Alloway pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Alloway acknowledges 3 prior OWI convictions. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT. Court accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Drewa - follow joint recommendation. Alloway withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 57 days; AODA and follow thru; 3 year DL revocation; IID on DL and all vehicles titlted in her name for 3 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL; fine of $3697.00 - paid within first 6 months of probation; 200 hours of community service; maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage (10 employers) when kids are in school; no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars; attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting each week; submit DNA sample if one has not already been submitted with no surcharge assessed, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on August 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 3:29 PM. Josephine Alloway appears in person and in custody with attorney Timothy Drewa. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believes the PH will be waived and have filed an Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of the waiver. Alloway and Drewa agree. Recess to fill out waiver of PH form (3:30 PM). Back on record at 3:32 PM with same appearances. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Drewa does have Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN today, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 8/20/14 at 1:15 PM.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Timothy Drewa in court, defendant Josephine R Alloway in custody/via video FC Jail.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:07 am. Has complaint waive reading. Court reads charges/penalties and rights. Bond continued. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bar or tavern. REFUSED to sign.
